resources.string: Body Mass Index (English: Body Mass Index, referred to as BMI), also known as Quetelet index (/kɛtəˈleɪ/[1]), referred to as body mass index[2], is calculated from a person\'s mass (weight) and height a numerical value. BMI is defined as weight divided by height squared, expressed in kilograms per square meter, and is derived from mass (kilograms) and height (meters)
